CWEs: CWE-78: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection')
description: The function noLocalBranchConflict is vulnerable to command injection because it concatenates a user-supplied string (branch) into a command that is executed by the system. An attacker could provide a branch name that includes shell commands, which would be executed with the same privileges as the process running the script. This could lead to arbitrary command execution.
